messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Religion and politics
messages.msgSnippet: Well, if we have to give up all the subjects that get folks dander up, then I guess we can t talk about not only politics and religion but must also leave out
messages.messageBody:
Well, if we have to give up all the subjects that get folks' dander up, then
I guess we can't talk about not only politics and religion but must also
leave out vaccinations, family beds, corporal punishment, H$LDA, the
definition of "unschooling," teachers, public school, curriculum, hmmmm.
What do we get to talk about <g> zzzzzzzzzz

Guess, we'll just have to up the caffeine to stay awake <<<BEWG>>>

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: "Mac and Carol Brown" <mjcmbrwn@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, January 25, 2001 10:42 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Religion and politics


> Oh dear - that was meant as a joke! Homeschooling lists in particular
> would be very quiet and uneventful without politics or religion!
>
> Carol
>
> > How boring! <beg>
> > Carol
> >
> > tonitoni@... wrote:
> >
> > > I was always told never to discuss religion or politics.......
> > > I believe those were very wise words.
> > > marianne
